  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes the add product controller. Generates product ID number and populates its field, Populates the available parts, and the associated parts tables.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url -
      resourceBundle -

    • onSearchInput

      protected void onSearchInput(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent keyEvent) throws IOException
      Searches for parts by Part ID or by Part Name. a UI error is called and displayed if no results are found.
      Parameters:
      keyEvent - typing text in the Part search field.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onAddClicked

      protected void onAddClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      On add clicked. Resets error and conformation UI, assigns the selected part to a variable, and checks if a part is selected. If a part is selected then it is added to an Observable array list that stores associated parts and the associated parts table is updated and the selected part is set back to null. If a part was not selected and UI error message is shown.
      Parameters:
      event - add button clicked
      Throws:
      IOException - the io exception

    • onRemoveClicked

      protected void onRemoveClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      On remove clicked. Resets error and conformation UI, assigns the selected part to a variable, and checks if a part is selected. If a part is selected then the deletion confirmation UI method is called. If a part was not selected and UI error message is shown.
      Parameters:
      event - on remove associated button clicked
      Throws:
      IOException - the io exception

    • yesClicked

      protected void yesClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Yes is clicked in the associated parts deletion confirmation. Resets UI, part IS deleted from the association table and selected part is set back to null.
      Parameters:
      event - the yes button clicked
      Throws:
      IOException - the io exception

    • noClicked

      protected void noClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      No is clicked in the associated parts deletion confirmation. The UI is reset.
      Parameters:
      event - the event
      Throws:
      IOException - the io exception

    • onSaveClicked

      protected void onSaveClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Save button clicked. Checks for any blanks in the input, checks if min is less than max, and checks if Inv is equal or less than max or equal to or greater than min. If any of those conditions are not met then the UI will display an error message related to the condition not met and will not save new product till conditions are met. Otherwise, the product will be saved to the inventory and the program will return to the main window.
      Parameters:
      event - the event
      Throws:
      IOException - the io exception

    • cancelButtonClicked

      protected void cancelButtonClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Cancel button clicked. Returns program back to the main window.
      Parameters:
      event - cancel button clicked
      Throws:
      IOException - the io exception

      private void returnToMainPage(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      returns program back to main window
      Parameters:

      Throws:

    • generateProductID

      private int generateProductID()
      Generates Unique Product ID number and checks if the generated already is used.
      Returns:
      generated product ID

    • verifyIfTaken

      private boolean verifyIfTaken(Integer num)
      Checks to make sure that generated ID Number is not already assigned to another product.
      Parameters:
      num - number generated
      Returns:
      true or false based on if the number is already assigned

      Parameters:
